entry.title: The state of Open Source in Robotics, Cloud Computing, and Cancer Research
entry.summary:
Description

I posit that well-made, open-source platforms with industry specific goals put more new tools in developer's hands each year than anything else. This talk will compare and get people excited about large open-source projects. What makes them great, what doesn't, and where to get started in Python.

Presentation page -- https://2018.pycon.ca/talks/talk-PC-54865 Author website -- https://github.com/danielsnider

entry.title: What kind of sorcery is OpenStack?
entry.summary:
Description

Lets clear the air about witchcraft and best practices in data center IT. Come listen to my rants and raves about OpenStack, the software that controls large armies of compute, storage, and networking resources. Why does OpenStack get so much hype and so much hate?

Daniel Snider Bio

Daniel Snider is a former OpenStack software engineer, UOIT undergraduate in Information Technology, IBM, and Google Summer of Code student. He is currently a bio-tech newbie at SickKids and roboticist at Ryerson University's R3 Robotics club.
